question: You rent an apartment and recently a new tenant moved in above you. This tenant’s behaviour is causing you a lot of problems. Write a letter to your landlord. In your letter:Describe what the new tenant is doing, explain why it is disturbing you so much, tell your landlord what you would like him/her to do about it
text: I  am writing this letter to complain about a tenant who recently moved in 301 flat, which is just above mine, whose actions are causing certain disturbances to me.
He starts playing loud music during the day time and since I work from my home, it is quite hard for me to concentrate on my tasks. Besides that, he is regularly smoking in the balcony.

I have faced several complaints from my manager and clients as they are agitated because of the noise and I am afraid I might lose them if this continues to happen.  Also, I am facing several health issues like coughing, breathing problems because of the smoking smell.

I have requested him to turn down the music, he could not compared so I would like to request you to install soundproof carpet that will be conducive to reduce the frequency of sound. It would be great if you could convince him not to smoke inside the building and have restrictions about smoking in the apartment.
I request you take an action immediately.
